comment.author: 69679868@N03
comment._content:
CWGC Site states that 13458 Lance Corporal Willie Bolton was the stepson of Herbert Spencer, of 8 Branston Terrace, Hunslet, Leeds, West Yorkshire.

Willie Bolton is commemorated on Panel 21 of the Menin Gate War Memorial.

11th(Service) Battalion West Yorkshire Regiment was in 69th Brigade in 23rd Division, and served in France and Flanders from 26th August 1915.

LCpl Willie Bolton was killed on the first day of the Battle of Messines - 7-14 June 1917 - when his battalion captured Hill 60, vital tactical ground held by the Germans, close to the village of Zillebeke.//
